page.title: 01Exmoor and Barle Valley
page.content: This aera is predominantly moorland dissected by one large and one small river. It is very sparsely populated, with only 3 remote, stonewalled farms and is served by less than one mile of public road. The only industry is subsistance agriculture based on sheep (Exmoor Horn Scotch blackface) and a few cattle. Wild life is abundant with peripatetic herds of indigenous red deer and Exmoor ponies, salmon,trout,and buzzards too. The landscape is virtualy treeless part from a few beech tree topped stone was (known as dykes)and a small plantation in the sheltered river valley (or combe) near Cow Castle, an ancient monument. In high summer, tourists ae seen walking in the 'Goyles'7 or steep valleys and canoeists appear on the river in flood.
